message:
Hello all
if you are using hipchat or slack this might be interesting

I have spent sometime to build and customize an instance of github's Hubot https://hubot.github.com/ . Hubot is a nodejs application that has various set of coffee scripts developed by the open source community that adds both fun and business oriented feature set to the Bot just by typing a keyword into hipchat (like a command).

I named the instance Jarvis (if you watched iron man you will get it :) ) and I hosted it on heroku and integrated it with hipchat which we use in my company and works like a charm (you can change the adapter from hipchat to slack)

Jarvis can make reminders, add trello cards in the order list for the food ordering search at google or just learn all sort of stuff from normal question answers to HR policies and vacation days

Just type @jarvis help and it will display a list of all the stuff he can do

Type (@jarvis learn x=y) and Jarvis will learn it as it have a postgres DB for data persistence. Ask him for what he learned just type (@jarvis tell x) and it will type y

Or just type (@jarvis talk) for an open chat with the minimized Jarvis AI engine and when you are finished type (@jarvis stop talking) to return to the normal commands triggered Jarvis

Jarvis code is on this public repository on github https://github.com/ahmed-yousry-ebrahim/jarvis and hosted at heroku so you are more than welcome to explore its code base or even to contribute writing a coffee script to make some interesting new thing and share it with all of us
story: Ahmed Yousry Ebrahim shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: ahmed-yousry-ebrahim/jarvis
caption: github.com
description: Contribute to jarvis development by creating an account on GitHub.

data.message: I appreciate that you took the time to write an introduction (Y)
